verses.text: They brought the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it. Then they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
verses.comment: David's tent for the ark parallels the account in 2 Samuel.

verses.text: After David finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
verses.comment: Blessing the people in the Lord's name is preserved from the Hebrew.

verses.text: He distributed to every Israelite, both men and women, a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a cake of raisins.
verses.comment: Translation clarifies 'each person' as 'every Israelite, both men and women.'

verses.text: David appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, to celebrate, thank, and praise the LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.comment: Levites are set for worship ministry.

verses.text: Asaph was the chief, and Zechariah was second. Then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel played the harps and lyres; Asaph sounded the cymbals.
verses.comment: List preserves Hebrew names and order.

verses.text: Benaiah and Jahaziel, priests, blew trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
verses.comment: Giving names in line with Hebrew spelling.

verses.text: On that day David first assigned Asaph and his brothers to give thanks to the LORD with this song:
verses.comment: Introduces the poetic thanksgiving, largely Psalm text.

verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD; call on His name; make known His deeds among the peoples.
Sing to Him, sing praises to Him; tell about all His wondrous deeds.
Glory in His holy name; let those who seek the LORD rejoice.
Seek the LORD and His strength; seek His face always.
Remember the wonders He has performed, His miracles and the judgments He pronounced.
O offspring of Israel, His servant, sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.
He is the LORD our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
Remember His covenant forever, the word He commanded, to a thousand generations,
verses.comment: ‘A thousand generations’ rendered as in Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: the covenant He made with Abraham, and the oath He swore to Isaac.
verses.comment: ‘Swore to Isaac’ clarified from the Hebrew.

verses.text: He confirmed it to Jacob as a statute, to Israel as an everlasting covenant,
saying, 'To you I will give the land of Canaan as your allotted inheritance.'
When you were few in number, very few, and sojourners in it,
wandering from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people,
He permitted no one to oppress them; He rebuked kings for their sake,
'Do not touch My anointed ones, do not harm My prophets.'
verses.comment: ‘Do not harm’ is natural English for ‘do my prophets no harm.’

verses.text: Sing to the LORD, all the earth; proclaim His salvation day after day.
verses.comment: Psalm content begins to blend in.

verses.text: Declare His glory among the nations, His marvelous deeds among all the peoples.
For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
verses.comment: ‘Greatly to be praised’ mirrors the underlying Hebrew.

verses.text: For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
Splendor and majesty are before Him; strength and joy are in His place.
verses.comment: ‘In His place’ kept literal for ‘in His sanctuary.’

verses.text: Ascribe to the LORD, families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name; bring an offering and come before Him; worship the LORD in the splendor of holiness.
Tremble before Him, all the earth. The world is firmly established; it shall not be moved.
verses.comment: Maintaining the parallel phrases of the Psalm.

verses.text: Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad, and let them say among the nations, 'The LORD reigns!'
Let the sea thunder and all that fills it; let the fields exult, and everything in them.
Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the LORD, for He is coming to judge the earth.
Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good, for His steadfast love endures forever.
Say, 'Save us, O God of our salvation, gather us and rescue us from the nations, that we may give thanks to Your holy name and glory in Your praise.'
Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. And all the people said, 'Amen,' and praised the LORD.
verses.comment: Verse ends the hymn with communal acclamation.

verses.text: So David left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD to minister regularly, according to each day's ritual.
And Obed-edom and sixty-eight of his brothers, and Obed-edom son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were appointed as gatekeepers.
verses.comment: Clarifies two Obed-edoms, as in the Hebrew text.

verses.text: Zadok the priest and his fellow priests were stationed before the dwelling place of the LORD at the high place in Gibeon,
to offer burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, following all that is written in the law of the LORD commanded to Israel.
With them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest who were chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the LORD, for His steadfast love endures forever.
verses.comment: ‘Designated by name’ for clarity on selection.

verses.text: Heman and Jeduthun had trumpets and cymbals for those who played, and instruments for the songs of God. The sons of Jeduthun were at the gate.
verses.comment: Musical assignment detailed as in Hebrew.

verses.text: Then all the people departed, each to his own house, and David returned to bless his own household.
verses.comment: Literal translation; ‘his household’ preserves original intent.
